alert.note: Alert for Dubois; Orange; Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 2:31PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Dubois, Orange and northwestern Washington Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 231 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Paoli to near Jasper. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paoli. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for south central Indiana.
